messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Creativity links
messages.msgSnippet: ... Wily Walnut is probably my favorite, if you haven t gotten to that one yet....I ve been emailing him for a few weeks, he s a really cool guy that is
messages.messageBody:
>> Wow Julie...I'm glad you found them!
Wily Walnut is probably my favorite, if you haven't gotten to that one
yet....I've been emailing him for a few weeks, he's a really cool guy that
is totally interested in learning more about unschooling.>>

I love that site. Check it out everyone!! Especially the Leonardo da Vinci
article.

I borrowed a book called Painting from the Source: Awakening your Artist's
Soul by Aviva Gold (who also leads workshops in creativity and healing).
Great book.

One more week till I can go and get my supplies and then get started. I
really want to get past my fears of failure and of painting something that
others won't find acceptable. Make it all about me and the process.

julie

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Creativity links
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/9/04 7:02:56 AM, starsuncloud@netzero.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/9/04 7:02:56 AM, starsuncloud@... writes:

<< The creativity links will be linked to my page about the creativity
workshop I'll be teaching. "Awakening the Dragon" is all about re-discovering the
creative genius you were meant to be. >>

And I haven't finished putting it up, I'm sorry. The boys have a new online
video game so I've been third to the computer for a couple of weeks, but you
should see the improvements in my YARD! <bwg> This morning I have a day lilie
blooming (we'll have over 100 blooms this year on those) and morning glories
(if anyone wants seeds for next year, I will DEFINITELY have enough to share
around), and I have a tomato an inch across. That's early, and I'm happy. I
put the plants in before the freezing was quite done and *duh* didn't cover them
at night (what was I not even thinking??) and they barely survived but they
did.

So, Ren's stuff....

I'll try to announce here when more is in.

Sandra

messages.subject: Creativity links
messages.msgSnippet: art: drawing, sculpting.... by the way Ren those creativity links of yours at Sandra s site have been manna for my soul.  Wow Julie...I m glad you found
messages.messageBody:
"art: drawing, sculpting.... by the way Ren those creativity links of yours at
Sandra's site have been manna for my soul. "

Wow Julie...I'm glad you found them!
Wily Walnut is probably my favorite, if you haven't gotten to that one yet....I've been emailing him for a few weeks, he's a really cool guy that is totally interested in learning more about unschooling.
He lives in England, and his son goes to a village school, with just a few kids in his class, and very open about what they learn.

The creativity links will be linked to my page about the creativity workshop I'll be teaching. "Awakening the Dragon" is all about re-discovering the creative genius you were meant to be.

If there are any creatives out there, or anyone that has forgotten they are a creative genius, check out a page of links just for you:

http://sandradodd.com/ren/creativity


Learn about unschooling at:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingbasics/
